page.title: 20Chilton-Ridgeway and Railway
page.content: The Ridgeway,designated in 1972 as the 7th. of the Countryside Commission's long distance routes, passes through the south-west corner of this block as it makes its way the 85 miles from Avebury in Wiltshire to Ivinghoe Beacon in Buckinghamshire.Crossing the A34 above Gore Hill,this part of the path affords fine views of the Downs and of the smoking towers of Didcot power station. -------------------- The Didcot to Southampton railway was started in 1876 and opened by Elizabeth Catherine, Countess of Caernarfon in 1878 at a cost of 397,484 pounds. The trains, running on a single track line, were passenger and cargo.A second track was built by the Americans for war-time transportation.As part of Lord Beeching's cuts in 1964, the line was closed.
